intro: Guizotia oleifera var. angustior, commonly known as narrowleaf guizotia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Pedaliaceae and is characterized by its slender, angular stems and small, yellow flowers. The plant produces distinctive, three-lobed seed pods that contain oily seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and as a source of oil. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. The species is also valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological benefits in supporting pollinators.
